Name: About Page
Title: About
Body:
About Map the Philippines

Map the Philippines (MapPH) is an international community working together with free mapping tools to help citizens, NGOs, business, schools, and government work better together to strengthen the resilience of our cities.

MapPH is a free and open source, open data platform that maps real time community needs, tracks public and private programs and services, and layers risk data to help achieve the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

We teach communities how to map with free mapping tools and how to report public and private sector needs. By layering data, we help visualize priorities, overlaps and gaps, to help stakeholders make more informed decisions about our communities.

Our goal is to map all 81 provinces to December 2017.

Map the Philippines is supported by Making All Voices Count (MAVC), an international initiative that supports effective and accountable governance and disaster resilience in 12 countries in Africa and Asia. They bring together actors from government, civil society, academia and the technology sector to find, support and learn from innovative ideas on how to improve the relationship between government and citizens. MAVC is funded by four donors: U.K Department for International Development (DFID), U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (SIDA), and the Omidyar Network (ON). The MAVC program is a partnership between Hivos, the Institute of Development Studies (IDS) and Ushahidi.
